00177 //    mmdb_f_quit_() disposes the file system. A correct use assumes that
00178 // it will be called before an application quits.
00179

00181 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
00182 
00183 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_QUIT, mmdb_f_quit, (),(),() );

00186 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00187 
00188 //    autoserials_(..) switches On/Off the regime of automatical
00189 // generation of atom serial numbers at reading from PDB ASCII file.
00190 // The autoserials regime is On if iOnOff parameter is set to
00191 // non-zero, and the regime is turned Off otherwise. The setting
00192 // will last until next call to autoserials_(..)
00193 //
00194 //    When this regime is Off (default state), all atom serial
00195 // numbers are expected to be in strictly incremental order and
00196 // any deviation from this rule will cause end of reading and
00197 // MMDB_F_Open_(..) will issue the RWBERR_AlreadySet error code. If
00198 // this code is then passed to error messengers (rberrstop_(..) or
00199 // rbcheckerr_(..)) the application will stop. It is Ok, however,
00200 // for serial numbers to increment by 2 or more.
00201 //
00202 //    When the autoserials regime is On, MMDB_F_Open_(..) does not pay
00203 // attention to the serial numbers and generates them for each
00204 // atom in strict incremental-by-one. This will work correctly only
00205 // if all atom records ("ATOM"/"HETATM", "SIGATM", "ANISOU" and
00206 // "SIGUIJ") are grouped, for every atom, as they should (precisely,
00207 // "ATOM" or "HETATM" opens the group, then "SIGATM", "ANISOU" and
00208 // "SIGUIJ" should follow until next "ATOM"/"HETATM" is met).
00209 
00210 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine AutoSerials ( iOnOff )
00211 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer  iOnOff
00212 
00213 FORTRAN_SUBR ( AUTOSERIALS,autoserials,
00214                ( int * iOnOff ),
00215                ( int * iOnOff ),
00216                ( int * iOnOff ) );
00217 
00218 
00219 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00220 
00221 //    setreadcoords_(..) switches On/Off the reading of atomic
00222 // coordinates when mmdb_f_open_ is called for input. The coordinates
00223 // will be read if iOnOff parameter is set to non-zero, otherwise
00224 // the reading will stop on the coordinate section of PDB file.
00225 // The setting will last until the next call to setreadcoords_(..).
00226 //
00227 //    By default, the coordinates are read.
00228 //
00229 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine SetReadCoords ( iOnOff )
00230 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer  iOnOff
00231 
00232 FORTRAN_SUBR ( SETREADCOORDS,setreadcoords,
00233                ( int * iOnOff ),
00234                ( int * iOnOff ),
00235                ( int * iOnOff ) );
00236 
00237 
00238 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00239 
00240 //    simrwbrook_(..) switches On/Off the regime of exact following
00241 // the old fortran RWBROOK's way of issuing messages and warnings.
00242 //
00243 //    By default, this regime is switched off, which supresses all
00244 // messages from mmdb_rwbrook unless directly ordered or catastrophic.
00245 // Switching this regime on will make the printout of converted
00246 // programs significantly closer to that resulting from the use of
00247 // old fortran RWBROOK package. The setting will last until the
00248 // next call to simrwbrook_(..).
00249 //
00250 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine SimRWBROOK ( iOnOff )
00251 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer  iOnOff
00252 
00253 FORTRAN_SUBR ( SIMRWBROOK,simrwbrook,
00254                ( int * iOnOff ),
00255                ( int * iOnOff ),
00256                ( int * iOnOff ) );
00257 
00258 
00259 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00260 
00261 //    mmdb_f_open_(..) associates a coordinate file with channel number
00262 // given in iUnit. If iUnit was previously associated with another
00263 // or the same file, the file gets complete logical reinitialization
00264 // which means that all previous modifications to the file are lost
00265 // unless stored on disk with mmdb_f_write_(..) or mmdb_f_close_(..).
00266 //
00267 //   If the file is to be opened for input (RWStat is set to
00268 // "INPUT"), all contents of the file is read into memory. It may be
00269 // then modified and written back into a file (same or different).
00270 //
00271 //   If the file is to be opened for output (RWStat is set to
00272 // "OUTPUT"), no file is physically opened, and only empty data
00273 // structure is created in the memory. It may then be added with the
00274 // data and stored in a disk file.
00275 //
00276 //   If FType is set to "PDB" or " ", the physical file is assumed
00277 // to be read or written in the PDB format. "CIF" option is reserved
00278 // for mmCIF files and is not realized at present. "BIN" means
00279 // binary format. Note that both file name and file type may be
00280 // changed before writting the file (see mmdb_f_setname_(..) and
00281 // mmdb_f_settype_(..)).
00282 //
00283 //   mmdb_f_open(..) sets an internal pointer to "before the first"
00284 // atom in the file (therefore it should be advanced to get access
00285 // to the first atom, see mmdb_f_advance1_(..)). This pointer is used
00286 // for getting atomic coordinates and other atomic characteristics
00287 // from the file structure or for storing them into the structure.
00288 // The pointer may be advanced, backspaced or set to a specific
00289 // position in the file structure (see below).
00290 //
00291 //   iRet returns the error code (defined above). Extended
00292 // information on the error may be then obtained through the
00293 // geterror_(..) function immediately after return from
00294 // mmdb_f_open_(..).
00295 
00296 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_Open ( LName,RWStat,FType,
00297 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                        iUnit,iRet )
00298 //                        character*(*)  LName,RWStat,FType
00299 //                        integer        iUnit,iRet
00300 
00301 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_OPEN, mmdb_f_open,
00302                (    // lengths-at-end list
00303                 mmdb::machine::fpstr LName,  // logical name
00304                 mmdb::machine::fpstr RWStat, // "INPUT" or "OUTPUT"
00305                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FType,  // "PDB", "CIF", "BIN" or " "
00306                 int * iUnit,      // channel number
00307                 int * iRet,       // returns error code
00308                 int   LName_len,  // fortran-hidden length of LName
00309                 int   RWStat_len, // fortran-hidden length of RWStat
00310                 int   FType_len   // fortran-hidden length of FType
00311                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
00312                 mmdb::machine::fpstr LName,
00313                 mmdb::machine::fpstr RWStat,
00314                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FType,
00315                 int * iUnit,  int * iRet
00316                ), ( // lengths-follow list
00317                 mmdb::machine::fpstr LName,   int LName_len,
00318                 mmdb::machine::fpstr RWStat,  int RWStat_len,
00319                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FType,   int FType_len,
00320                 int * iUnit,   int * iRet
00321                ) );
00322 
00323

00326 
00327 //    mmdb_f_open1_(..) is equivalent to mmdb_f_open_(..) but takes directly
00328 // the file name (FName) instead of logical name (LName).
00329 //
00330 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_Open1 ( FName,RWStat,FType,
00331 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                         iUnit,iRet )
00332 //                        character*(*)  FName,RWStat,FType
00333 //                        integer        iUnit,iRet
00334 
00335 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_OPEN1, mmdb_f_open1,
00336                (    // lengths-at-end list
00337                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FName,  // file name
00338                 mmdb::machine::fpstr RWStat, // "INPUT" or "OUTPUT"
00339                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FType,  // "PDB", "CIF", "BIN" or " "
00340                 int * iUnit,      // channel number
00341                 int * iRet,       // returns error code
00342                 int   FName_len,  // fortran-hidden length of FName
00343                 int   RWStat_len, // fortran-hidden length of RWStat
00344                 int   FType_len   // fortran-hidden length of FType
00345                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
00346                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FName,
00347                 mmdb::machine::fpstr RWStat,
00348                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FType,
00349                 int * iUnit,  int * iRet
00350                ), ( // lengths-follow list
00351                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FName,   int FName_len,
00352                 mmdb::machine::fpstr RWStat,  int RWStat_len,
00353                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FType,   int FType_len,
00354                 int * iUnit,   int * iRet
00355                ) );

00359 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00360 
00361 //    mmdb_f_copy_(..) copies the specified part(s) of iUnit2 into iUnit1.
00362 // All data which contained in the corresponding part(s) of iUnit1
00363 // before the copying, is destroyed.
00364 //
00365 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_Copy ( iUnit1,iUnit2,
00366 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                        copyKey,iRet )
00367 //                        integer  iUnit1,iUnit2,copyKey,iRet
00368 
00369 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_COPY, mmdb_f_copy,
00370                (    // lengths-at-end list
00371                 int * iUnit1,    // destination unit
00372                 int * iUnit2,    // source unit
00373                 int * copyKey,   // copy key:
00374                                  //  = 1  copy all
00375                                  //  = 2  copy all except coordinates
00376                                  //  = 3  copy title section only
00377                                  //  = 4  copy crystallographic
00378                                  //       section only
00379                                  //  = 5  copy coordinate section only
00380                                  // any other value does not do anything
00381                 int * iRet       // return code:
00382                                  //   =0 if success
00383                                  //   =RWBERR_NoChannel if a unit
00384                                  //                   does not exist
00385                                  //   =RWBERR_NoFile    if a unit
00386                                  //                   was not opened
00387                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
00388                 int * iUnit1,  int * iUnit2,
00389                 int * copyKey, int * iRet
00390                ), ( // lengths-follow list
00391                 int * iUnit1,  int * iUnit2,
00392                 int * copyKey, int * iRet
00393                ) );
00394 
00395 
00396 
00397 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00398 
00399 //    mmdb_f_delete_(..) deletes the specified parts of iUnit-th unit.
00400 // The delete keys are exactly the same as copy keys in mmdb_f_copy_(..).
00401 //
00402 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_Delete ( iUnit1,iUnit2,
00403 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                        CopyAtoms,iRet )
00404 //                        integer  iUnit1,iUnit2,CopyAtoms,iRet
00405 
00406 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_DELETE, mmdb_f_delete,
00407                (    // lengths-at-end list
00408                 int * iUnit,     // unit number; *iUnit<=0 means
00409                                  // "the last mentioned unit"
00410                 int * delKey,    // delete key:
00411                                  //  = 1  delete all
00412                                  //  = 2  delete all except coordinates
00413                                  //  = 3  delete title section only
00414                                  //  = 4  delete crystallographic
00415                                  //       section only
00416                                  //  = 5  delete coordinate section only
00417                                  // any other value does not do anything
00418                 int * iRet       // return code:
00419                                  //   =0 if success
00420                                  //   =RWBERR_NoChannel if a unit
00421                                  //                   does not exist
00422                                  //   =RWBERR_NoFile    if a unit
00423                                  //                   was not opened
00424                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
00425                 int * iUnit, int * delKey, int * iRet
00426                ), ( // lengths-follow list
00427                 int * iUnit, int * delKey, int * iRet
00428                ) );
00429

00433 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00434 
00435 //   mmdb_f_settype_(..) changes the type and/or the read/write mode of
00436 // a unit iUnit, previously initialized with mmdb_f_open_(..). The file
00437 // is not read from or purged onto disk, no data change occurs.
00438 //
00439 //   iRet returns either RWBERR_NoChannel if the unit was not
00440 // previously initialized by mmdb_f_open_(..), or RWBERR_Ok in the case
00441 // of success.
00442 
00443 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_SetType ( iUnit,FType,
00444 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                           RWState,iRet )
00445 //                        character*(*)  FType,RWState
00446 //                        integer        iUnit,iRet
00447 
00448 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_SETTYPE, mmdb_f_settype,
00449                (    // lengths-at-end list
00450                 int * iUnit,     // unit number
00451                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FType,  // "PDB", "CIF", "BIN" or " "
00452                 mmdb::machine::fpstr RWStat, // "INPUT" or "OUTPUT"
00453                 int * iRet,      // returns -1 if unit not found,
00454                                  // otherwise 0
00455                 int   FType_len, // fortran-hidden length of FType
00456                 int   RWStat_len // fortran-hidden length of RWStat
00457                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
00458                 int * iUnit,  mmdb::machine::fpstr FType,
00459                 mmdb::machine::fpstr RWStat, int * iRet
00460                ), ( // lengths-follow list
00461                 int * iUnit,
00462                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FType,   int FType_len,
00463                 mmdb::machine::fpstr RWStat,  int RWStat_len,
00464                 int * iRet
00465                ) );
00466

00471 //   mmdb_f_setname_(..) changes the file name for a unit iUnit,
00472 // previously initialized with mmdb_f_open_(..). The file is not
00473 // read from or purged onto disk, no data change occurs.
00474 //
00475 //   iRet returns either RWBERR_NoChannel if the unit was not
00476 // previously initialized by mmdb_f_open_(..), or RWBERR_Ok in the case
00477 // of success.
00478 
00479 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_SetName ( iUnit,FName,
00480 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                           iRet )
00481 //                        character*(*)  FName
00482 //                        integer        iUnit,iRet
00483 
00484 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_SETNAME, mmdb_f_setname,
00485                (    // lengths-at-end list
00486                 int * iUnit,    // unit number
00487                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FName,    // file name
00488                 int * iRet,     // returns -1 if unit not found,
00489                                 // otherwise 0
00490                 int   FName_len // fortran-hidden length of FName
00491                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
00492                 int * iUnit, mmdb::machine::fpstr FName, int * iRet
00493                ), ( // lengths-follow list
00494                 int * iUnit,
00495                 mmdb::machine::fpstr FName, int FName_len,
00496                 int * iRet
00497                ) );

00501 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00502 
00503 //    mmdb_f_write_(..) writes content of unit iUnit into a disk file.
00504 // iRet will be set to -1 if the unit was not previously opened with
00505 // mmdb_f_open_(..). If writting was successful, iRet is set to 0,
00506 // otherwise geterror(..) will return an information about the
00507 // error occured.
00508 //
00509 //   Note that you may write even units associated with input in
00510 // call to mmdb_f_open(..). The file type does not change unless
00511 // explicitely changed with mmdb_f_settype_(..).
00512 
00513 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_Write ( iUnit,iRet )
00514 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer  iUnit,iRet
00515 
00516 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_WRITE,  mmdb_f_write,
00517                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ),
00518                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ),
00519                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ) );
00520 
00521 
00522 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00523 
00524 //   mmdb_f_close_(..) acts as mmdb_f_write_(..) if unit iUnit has been
00525 // associated with output in mmdb_f_open_(..) or in the call to
00526 // mmdb_f_settype(..). After writing the file, the unit iUnit is
00527 // completely disposed.
00528 //   If unit iUnit is associated with input, mmdb_f_close_(..) merely
00529 // disposes it and all the information contained will be lost.
00530 
00531 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_Close ( iUnit,iRet )
00532 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer  iUnit,iRet
00533 
00534 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_CLOSE,  mmdb_f_close,
00535                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ),
00536                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ),
00537                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ) );
00538 
00539 
00540 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00541 
00542 //   If unit iUnit is associated with input, mmdb_f_advance_(..) sets
00543 // the internal pointer on the next atom in the file. The atom
00544 // properties may then be retrieved using mmdb_f_atom_(..) and
00545 // mmdb_f_coord_(..). If iTer is set to 0, then 'ter' cards are
00546 // completely ignored. If iTer is set to 1, then 'ter' card will
00547 // cause return with iRet=1 with internal pointer left on this 'ter'
00548 // card. iRet=2 mean end of file, and iRet=0 means that the pointer
00549 // was successfully advanced to the next atom.
00550 //
00551 //   If unit iUnit is associated with output, mmdb_f_advance_(..)
00552 // merely advances the pointer. No actual change in the data
00553 // structure or on disk occurs. The new position will be filled with
00554 // atom data after execution of mmdb_f_atom_(..) and/or mmdb_f_coord_(..).
00555 // The pointer WILL NOT be advanced if none of these functions were
00556 // called since last advancement, in which case iRet will return
00557 // RWBERR_NoAdvance. After successfull advancement, iRet will
00558 // return 0.
00559 
00560 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_Advance ( iUnit,iOut,iTer,iRet )
00561 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer  iUnit,iOut,iTer,iRet
00562 
00563 //  Relation to the former XYZAdvance fortran subroutione:
00564 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
00565 //
00566 //      subroutine XYZAdvance ( iUnit,iOut,iTer,*,* )
00567 //      integer       iRet
00568 //      character*80  ErrLin
00569 //      call MMDB_F_Advance ( iUnit,iOut,iTer,iRet )
00570 //      if (iRet.eq.1)  return 1
00571 //      if (iRet.eq.2)  return 2
00572 //      if (iRet.eq.RWBERR_NoChannel) then
00573 //        ErrLin = ' ERROR: in MMDB_F_ADVANCE file has not been opened'
00574 //        call CCPErr ( 1,ErrLin )
00575 //      endif
00576 //      return
00577 //      end
00578 //
00579 //  where parameter iOut IS NOT USED.
00580 
00581 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_ADVANCE, mmdb_f_advance,
00582                (   // lengths-at-end list
00583                 int * iUnit, // unit number
00584                 int * iOut,  // output echo file
00585                 int * iTer,  // FLAG =1, return iRet=1 if 'ter' card found
00586                              //      =0, do not return on 'ter' card
00587                 int * iRet   // =0  if normal return
00588                              // =1  if return on 'ter' card (iTer=1)
00589                              // =2  if return on end of file
00590                              // =3  if return on 'hetatm' card
00591                              // =RWBERR_NoChannel if unit does not exist
00592                              // =RWBERR_NoAdvance if pointer was not
00593                              //                   advanced
00594                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
00595                 int * iUnit, int * iOut, int * iTer, int * iRet
00596                ), ( // lengths-follow list
00597                 int * iUnit, int * iOut, int * iTer, int * iRet
00598                ) );
00599 
00600 
00601 
00602 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00603 
00604 //   mmdb_f_rewd_(..) sets the internal pointer to the "begining" of
00605 // the data structure associated with unit *iUnit. This means that
00606 // one should the "advance" it with mmdb_f_advance_(..) in order
00607 // to get access to the first atom.
00608 //   iRet returns RWBERR_NoChannel if iUnit-th unit was not
00609 // initialized, RWBWAR_RewOutput if the unit was associated with
00610 // output, and 0 otherwise.
00611 
00612 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_Rewd ( iUnit,iRet )
00613 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer  iUnit,iRet
00614 
00615 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_REWD, mmdb_f_rewd,
00616                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ),
00617                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ),
00618                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ) );
00619 
00620 
00621 
00622 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00623 
00624 //   mmdb_f_bksp_(..) shifts the internal pointer for one atom back in
00625 // the data structure associated with unit *iUnit. This means that
00626 // the combination of mmdb_f_advance1_(..) and mmdb_f_bksp_(..) leaves the
00627 // pointer unchanged.
00628 //   iRet returns RWBERR_NoChannel if iUnit-th unit was not
00629 // initialized, and sets bit RWBWAR_RewOutput if the unit was
00630 // associated with output, RWBWAR_FileTop if the pointer is already
00631 // on the top of the structure, and 0 otherwise.
00632 
00633 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_Bksp ( iUnit,iRet )
00634 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer  iUnit,iRet
00635 
00636 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_BKSP, mmdb_f_bksp,
00637                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ),
00638                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ),
00639                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ) );
00640 
00641 
00642 
00643 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00644 
00645 //   mmdb_f_seek_(..) sets the internal pointer to the specified
00646 // position. If fPos==0, *iRet will return bit RWBWAR_FileTop.
00647 //   If unit iUnit is associated with input, iRet will return 2 if
00648 // fPos is given a value outside the file range, 1 if a 'ter' card
00649 // is met and 3 if a 'hetatm' card is met.
00650 //   iRet returns RWBERR_NoChannel if iUnit-th unit was not
00651 // initialized, and RWBERR_EmptyPointer if fPos-th position in the
00652 // input file is not occupied.
00653 
00654 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_Seek ( iUnit,fPos,iRet )
00655 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer  iUnit,fPos,iRet
00656 
00657 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_SEEK, mmdb_f_seek,
00658                (    // lengths-at-end list
00659                 int * iUnit,  // unit number
00660                 int * fPos,   // position to set
00661                 int * iRet    // return code:
00662                               //  0   Ok
00663                               //  1   'ter' card met
00664                               //  2   end of file
00665                               //  3   'hetatm' card met
00666                               //  <0 error:
00667                               //  RWBERR_NoChannel
00668                               //      iUnit was not
00669                               //      initialized
00670                               //  RWBERR_EmptyPointer
00671                               //      fPos-th position
00672                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
00673                 int * iUnit, int * fPos, int * iRet
00674                ), ( // lengths-follow list
00675                 int * iUnit, int * fPos, int * iRet
00676                ) );
00677 
00678 
00679 
00680 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00681 
00682 //   mmdb_f_atom_(..) reads or writes the atom name, residue name,
00683 // chain name and other parameters listed from/into the
00684 // data structure associated with the unit number iUnit (cf.
00685 // mmdb_f_open_(..)). The position in the structure is adjusted
00686 // with the help of mmdb_f_advance_(..), mmdb_f_rewd_(..) or
00687 // mmdb_f_bksp_(..).
00688 
00689 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_Atom ( iUnit,iSer,AtNam,
00690 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                 ResNam,ChnNam,iResN,ResNo,
00691 //                                      InsCod,AltCod,SegID,IZ,ID,
00692 //                                      iRet )
00693 //                        integer       iUnit,iSer,iResN,IZ,iRet
00694 //                        character*(*) AtNam,ResNam,ChnNam,ResNo
00695 //                        character*(*) InsCod,AltCod,SegID,ID
00696 
00697 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_ATOM,  mmdb_f_atom,
00698            (    // lengths-at-end list
00699             int * iUnit,    // unit number
00700             int * iSer,     // atom serial number
00701             mmdb::machine::fpstr AtNam,    // atom name (left justified)
00702             mmdb::machine::fpstr ResNam,   // residue name
00703             mmdb::machine::fpstr ChnNam,   // chain name
00704             int * iResN,    // residue number as an integer
00705             mmdb::machine::fpstr ResNo,    // residue number as character (input only)
00706             mmdb::machine::fpstr InsCod,   // the insertion code
00707             mmdb::machine::fpstr AltCod,   // the alternate conformation code
00708             mmdb::machine::fpstr segID,    // segment ID
00709             int * IZ,       // atomic number (input only, returned as
00710                             // 7 from ambiguous atoms)
00711             mmdb::machine::fpstr ID,       // atomic ID related to atomic number
00712                             // (element symbol right justified), plus
00713                             // the ionic state +2, +3 etc..
00714                             //
00715             int * iRet,     // returns
00716                             //  RWBERR_NoChannel     if iUnit was not
00717                             //                       initialized
00718                             //  RWBERR_EmptyPointer  if atom was not
00719                             //                       advanced
00720                             //  RWBERR_Error1        internal error #1
00721                             //  RWBERR_Error2        internal error #2
00722                             //  RWBERR_Error3        internal error #3
00723                             //
00724                             //  >=0 : success, warning flags:
00725                             //  RWBWAR_WrongSerial   if serial number
00726                             //               differs from the position
00727                             //               number in the file
00728                             //  RWBWAR_UnkFormFactor unknown formfactor
00729                             //  RWBWAR_AmbFormFactor ambiguous formfactor
00730                             //
00731             int AtNam_len,  // fortran-hidden length of AtNam
00732             int ResNam_len, // fortran-hidden length of ResNam
00733             int ChnNam_len, // fortran-hidden length of ChnNam
00734             int ResNo_len,  // fortran-hidden length of ResNo
00735             int InsCod_len, // fortran-hidden length of InsCod
00736             int AltCod_len, // fortran-hidden length of AltCod
00737             int segID_len,  // fortran-hidden length of SegID
00738             int ID_len      // fortran-hidden length of ID
00739            ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
00740             int * iUnit,  int * iSer,
00741             mmdb::machine::fpstr AtNam,
00742             mmdb::machine::fpstr ResNam,
00743             mmdb::machine::fpstr ChnNam, int * iResN,
00744             mmdb::machine::fpstr ResNo,
00745             mmdb::machine::fpstr InsCod,
00746             mmdb::machine::fpstr AltCod,
00747             mmdb::machine::fpstr segID, int * IZ,
00748             mmdb::machine::fpstr ID,
00749             int * iRet
00750            ), ( // lengths-follow list
00751             int * iUnit,  int * iSer,
00752             mmdb::machine::fpstr AtNam,  int   AtNam_len,
00753             mmdb::machine::fpstr ResNam, int   ResNam_len,
00754             mmdb::machine::fpstr ChnNam, int   ChnNam_len,
00755             int * iResN,
00756             mmdb::machine::fpstr ResNo,  int   ResNo_len,
00757             mmdb::machine::fpstr InsCod, int   InsCod_len,
00758             mmdb::machine::fpstr AltCod, int   AltCod_len,
00759             mmdb::machine::fpstr segID,  int   segID_len,
00760             int * IZ,
00761             mmdb::machine::fpstr ID,     int   ID_len,
00762             int * iRet
00763            ) );
00764 
00765 
00766 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00767 
00768 //    mmdb_f_copyatom_(..) copies atom from current position in
00769 //  channel iUnit1 to current position in channel iUnit2.
00770 
00771 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_CopyAtom ( iUnit1,
00772 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                 iUnit2,iRet )
00773 //                        integer iUnit1,iUnit2,iRet
00774 
00775 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_COPYATOM, mmdb_f_copyatom,
00776                ( // length-at-end list
00777     int * iUnit1, // source channel number
00778                 int * iUnit2, // destination channel number
00779                 int * iRet    // returns
00780                               //  RWBERR_NoChannel     if iUnit was not
00781                               //                       initialized
00782                               //  RWBERR_EmptyPointer  if atom was not
00783                               //                       advanced
00784                               //  >=0 : success
00785          ), ( // length-in-structure list
00786                 int * iUnit1, int * iUnit2, int * iRet
00787                ), ( // length-follow list
00788                 int * iUnit1, int * iUnit2, int * iRet

00792 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00793 
00794 //   mmdb_f_coord_(..) reads or writes the atom coordinates, occupancy
00795 // and temperature factor from/into the data structure associated
00796 // with the unit number iUnit (cf. mmdb_f_open_(..)). The position in
00797 // the structure is adjusted with the help of  mmdb_f_advance_(..),
00798 // mmdb_f_rewd_(..) or mmdb_f_bksp_(..).
00799 //   It is important that mmdb_f_coord_(..) was called AFTER
00800 // mmdb_f_atom_(..) if channel iUnit is associated with output
00801 // (otherwise iRet will return RWBERR_EmptyPointer).
00802 
00803 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_Coord ( iUnit,XFlag,BFlag,
00804 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                 x,y,z,occ,BIso,U,iRet )
00805 //                        integer       iUnit,iRet
00806 //                        character*(*) XFlag,BFlag
00807 //                        real          x,y,z,occ,BIso,U(6)
00808 
00809 //  Be sure that real-type parameters of mmdb_f_coord_(..) match those
00810 //  of FORTRAN call. The real type is set with typedef apireal
00811 //  statement in the begining of this file.
00812 
00813 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_COORD, mmdb_f_coord,
00814                (    // lengths-at-end list
00815                 int * iUnit,    // unit number
00816                 mmdb::machine::fpstr XFlag,    // "F" or "O" flag for the fractional
00817                                 // or orthogonal coordinates x,y,z
00818                                 // for output files XFlag may also be
00819                                 // set to "HF" or "HO", where "F" and
00820                                 // "O" have the same meaning as before
00821                                 // and "H" indicates that the atom
00822                                 // should be marked as heteroatom
00823                 mmdb::machine::fpstr BFlag ,   // "F" or "O" flag for temperature
00824                                 // factor in fractional or orthogonal
00825                                 // Us
00826                 mmdb::machine::apireal * x,    // x-coordinate
00827                 mmdb::machine::apireal * y,    // y-coordinate
00828                 mmdb::machine::apireal * z,    // z-coordinate
00829                 mmdb::machine::apireal * occ,  // occupancy
00830                 mmdb::machine::apireal * BIso, // isotropic temperature factor
00831                 mmdb::machine::apireal * U,    // array(6) of the anisotr. t-factor
00832                 int * iRet,     // returns
00833                                 //  RWBERR_NoChannel     if iUnit was not
00834                                 //                       initialized
00835                                 //  RWBERR_EmptyPointer  if atom was not
00836                                 //                       advanced
00837                                 //  RWBERR_NoMatrices    if transformation
00838                                 //                       matrices are
00839                                 //                       undefined
00840                                 //  RWBERR_NoCoordinates if coordinates were
00841                                 //                       not set in the atom
00842                                 //
00843                                 //  >=0 : success, warning flags:
00844                                 //  RWBERR_NoOccupancy   if occupancy was
00845                                 //                       not set in the atom
00846                                 //  RWBERR_NoTempFactor  if temp. factor was
00847                                 //                       not set in the atom
00848                                 //
00849                 int XFlag_len,  // fortran-hidden length of XFlag
00850                 int BFlag_len   // fortran-hidden length of BFlag
00851                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
00852                 int * iUnit,
00853                 mmdb::machine::fpstr XFlag,
00854                 mmdb::machine::fpstr BFlag,
00855                 mmdb::machine::apireal * x,
00856                 mmdb::machine::apireal * y,
00857                 mmdb::machine::apireal * z,
00858                 mmdb::machine::apireal * occ,
00859                 mmdb::machine::apireal * BIso,
00860                 mmdb::machine::apireal * U,
00861                 int * iRet
00862                ), ( // lengths-follow list
00863                 int * iUnit,
00864                 mmdb::machine::fpstr XFlag,   int XFlag_len,
00865                 mmdb::machine::fpstr BFlag,   int BFlag_len,
00866                 mmdb::machine::apireal * x,
00867                 mmdb::machine::apireal * y,
00868                 mmdb::machine::apireal * z,
00869                 mmdb::machine::apireal * occ,
00870                 mmdb::machine::apireal * BIso,
00871                 mmdb::machine::apireal * U,
00872                 int * iRet
00873                ) );
00874

00877 
00878 //   mmdb_f_setter_(..) sets the termination flag, so that the current
00879 // atom will be converted into terminator of a chain and appear as
00880 // 'ter' card in the output. The atom should be set by mmdb_f_atom_
00881 // first, but the coordinates (mmdb_f_coord_(..)) do not have to be
00882 // specified.
00883 
00884 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_SetTer ( iUnit,iRet )
00885 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer  iUnit,iRet
00886 
00887 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_SETTER, mmdb_f_setter,
00888                ( int * iUnit, int * iRet ),

00891 
00892 
00893 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00894 
00895 //   mmdb_f_sethet_(..) sets the heteroatom flag, so that the current
00896 // atom will appear as 'hetatm' card in the output. The atom should
00897 // be set by mmdb_f_atom_ first and then mmdb_f_coord_(..) and
00898 // mmdb_f_sethet_(..) should be called to specify its coordinates and
00899 // heteroatom status.
00900 
00901 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_SetHet ( iUnit,iRet )
00902 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer  iUnit,iRet
00903

00911 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
00912 
00913 //   mmdb_f_setcell_(..) sets the crystal cell properties and calculates
00914 // the orthogonal-fractional transformation matrices for unit iUnit.
00915 
00916 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_SetCell ( iUnit,a,b,c,
00917 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                        alpha,beta,gamma,
00918 //                                             ArgNCode,iRet )
00919 //                        integer       iUnit,ArgNCode,iRet
00920 //                        real          a,b,c,alpha,beta,gamma
00921 
00922 
00923 //  Relation to the former RBFRAC2 FORTRAN subroutine:
00924 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
00925 //     subroutine  RBFRAC2 ( a,b,c,alpha,beta,gamma,ArgNCode )
00926 //
00927 //  ** the unit number iUnit and buffer for the return code iRet
00928 //     have to be supplied.
00929 
00930 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_SETCELL, mmdb_f_setcell,
00931                (   //   lengths-at-end list
00932                 int     * iUnit,    // unit number; *iUnit<=0 means
00933                                     // "the last mentioned unit"
00934                 mmdb::machine::apireal * a,     // cell parameter a, angstroms
00935                 mmdb::machine::apireal * b,     // cell parameter b, angstroms
00936                 mmdb::machine::apireal * c,     // cell parameter c, angstroms
00937                 mmdb::machine::apireal * alpha, // cell parameter alpha, degrees
00938                 mmdb::machine::apireal * beta,  // cell parameter beta,  degrees
00939                 mmdb::machine::apireal * gamma, // cell parameter gamma, degrees
00940                 int     * ArgNCode, // orthogonalization code, 1-6
00941                 int     * iRet      // return code:
00942                                     //   RWBERR_Ok  - success
00943                                     //   RWBERR_NoChannel     if unit
00944                                     //              iUnit was not
00945                                     //              initialized
00946                                     //   RWBERR_NoFile        if unit
00947                                     //              has been disposed
00948                                     //   RWBERR_Disagreement  if a
00949                                     //              disagreement in
00950                                     //              cell parameters
00951                                     //              was found
00952                                     //   RWBERR_NoOrthCode    if no
00953                                     //              orthogonalization
00954                                     //              code was found
00955                                     //   RWBERR_NoCheck       if check
00956                                     //              of cell parameters
00957                                     //              has failed.
00958                                     //   The last three returns would
00959                                     // rather indicate a programming
00960                                     // error in mmdb_rwbrook.cpp
00961                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
00962                 int     * iUnit,
00963                 mmdb::machine::apireal * a,
00964                 mmdb::machine::apireal * b,
00965                 mmdb::machine::apireal * c,
00966                 mmdb::machine::apireal * alpha,
00967                 mmdb::machine::apireal * beta,
00968                 mmdb::machine::apireal * gamma,
00969                 int     * ArgNCode, int     * iRet
00970                ), ( // lengths-follow list
00971                 int     * iUnit,
00972                 mmdb::machine::apireal * a,
00973                 mmdb::machine::apireal * b,
00974                 mmdb::machine::apireal * c,
00975                 mmdb::machine::apireal * alpha,
00976                 mmdb::machine::apireal * beta,
00977                 mmdb::machine::apireal * gamma,
00978                 int     * ArgNCode, int     * iRet
00979                )
00980              );
00981

01063 
01064 //   mmdb_f_wbcell_(..) sets the crystal cell properties into the
01065 // channel iUnit.
01066 
01067 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_WBCell ( iUnit,ArgCell,
01068 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                        ArgNCode,iRet )
01069 //                        integer iUnit,ArgNCode,iRet
01070 //                        real    ArgCell(6)
01071 //
01072 
01073 //  Relation to the former WBCELL FORTRAN subroutine:
01074 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
01075 //     subroutine  WBCELL ( iUnit,ArgCell,ArgNCode )
01076 //
01077 //  ** the buffer for the return code iRet has to be supplied
01078 
01079 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_WBCELL, mmdb_f_wbcell,
01080                (    // lengths-at-end list
01081                 int     * iUnit,    // unit number; *iUnit<=0 means
01082                                     // "the last mentioned unit"
01083                 mmdb::machine::apireal * ArgCell,  // array to accept the cell parameters
01084                                     // if ArgCell(1) is set to 0, then
01085                                     // the cell does not change
01086                 int     * ArgNCode, // orthogonalisation code
01087                                     // if ArgNCode is set to 0, then
01088                                     // the orthogonalisation matrices
01089                                     // do not change
01090                 int     * iRet      // return code
01091                                     //   RWBERR_Ok  - success
01092                                     //   RWBERR_NoChannel     if unit
01093                                     //              iUnit was not
01094                                     //              initialized
01095                                     //   RWBERR_NoFile        if unit
01096                                     //              has been disposed
01097                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
01098                 int * iUnit,    mmdb::machine::apireal * ArgCell,
01099                 int * ArgNCode, int     * iRet
01100                ), ( // lengths-follow list
01101                 int * iUnit,    mmdb::machine::apireal * ArgCell,
01102                 int * ArgNCode, int     * iRet
01103                )
01104              );

01275 //   mmdb_f_rborf_(..) fills or retrieves the fractionalising (RF) and
01276 // orthogonalising (RO) 4x4 matrices, as well as the orthogonalisation
01277 // code (LCode) in/from unit iUnit.
01278 //   If RO[1][1] (fortran notations, or RO[0] in C/C++) is set to 0.0
01279 // then the matrices are retrieved and returned in RF and RO;
01280 // otherwise RF and RO are stored in the unit.

01283 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                         LCode,iRet )

01292 //     have to be supplied.

01297                                   // "the last mentioned unit"
01298                  mmdb::machine::apireal * RO,    // array for orthogonalising matrix
01299                  mmdb::machine::apireal * RF,    // array for fractionalising matrix
01300                  int     * LCode, // buffer for orthogonalisation code
01301                  int     * iRet   // return code:
01302                                   //   RWBERR_Ok  - success
01303                                   //   RWBERR_NoChannel     if unit
01304                                   //              iUnit was not
01305                                   //              initialized
01306                                   //   RWBERR_NoFile        if unit
01307                                   //              has been disposed
01308                                   //   RWBERR_NoMatrices    if the
01309                                   //              orthogonalisation
01310                                   //              matrices were not
01311                                   //              calculated
01312                 ), ( // lengths-in-structure list

01327 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
01328 
01329 //   mmdb_f_orthmat_(..) calculates matrices for standard orthogonalisations
01330 // and cell volume.
01331 //   If Cell(1) is greater then zero, the existing cell parameters
01332 // will be substituted. If new cell parameters differ substantially
01333 // from the old ones, the returned value of Vol will be negative.
01334 
01335 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_OrthMat ( iUnit,Cell,Vol,
01336 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                        RRR,iRet
01337 //                        integer  iUnit,iRet
01338 //                        real     Cell(6),Vol,RRR(3,3,6)
01339 
01340 //  Relation to the former RBFRO1 FORTRAN subroutine:
01341 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
01342 //     subroutine  RBFRO1 ( Cell,Vol,RRR )
01343 //
01344 //  ** the unit number iUnit and buffer for the return code iRet
01345 //     have to be supplied.
01346 
01347 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_ORTHMAT, mmdb_f_orthmat,
01348                (     // lengths-at-end list
01349                 int     * iUnit, // unit number; *iUnit<=0 means
01350                                  // "the last mentioned unit"
01351                 mmdb::machine::apireal * Cell,  // array of cell parameters:
01352                                  //  Cell(1) - a   Cell(4) - alpha
01353                                  //  Cell(2) - b   Cell(5) - beta
01354                                  //  Cell(3) - c   Cell(6) - gamma
01355                 mmdb::machine::apireal * Vol,   // returns cell volume
01356                 mmdb::machine::apireal * RRR,   // array (3,3,6), returns
01357                                  // orthogonalisation matrices
01358                 int     * iRet   // return code:
01359                                  //   RWBERR_Ok  - success
01360                                  //   RWBERR_NoChannel     if unit
01361                                  //              iUnit was not
01362                                  //              initialized
01363                                  //   RWBERR_NoFile        if unit
01364                                  //              has been disposed
01365                                  //   RWBERR_NoMatrices    if the
01366                                  //              orthogonalisation
01367                                  //              matrices were not
01368                                  //              calculated
01369                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
01370                 int     * iUnit,
01371                 mmdb::machine::apireal * Cell,
01372                 mmdb::machine::apireal * Vol,
01373                 mmdb::machine::apireal * RRR,   int * iRet
01374                ), ( // lengths-follow list
01375                 int     * iUnit,
01376                 mmdb::machine::apireal * Cell,
01377                 mmdb::machine::apireal * Vol,
01378                 mmdb::machine::apireal * RRR,   int * iRet
01379                )
01380              );

01429 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
01430 
01431 //   mmdb_f_wremark_(..) writes a remark line into data structure.
01432 // Generally, it puts the line on its place according to a PDB
01433 // keyword which should start the line. The line will be always the
01434 // last one in its group (last remark with given number or without
01435 // it, last JRNL record, last ATOM etc.). If the keyword is not
01436 // recognized, the line is appended after the coordinate section.
01437 //   iRet will return same codes as those in mmdb_f_open1_(..) plus
01438 // additional ones specified below.
01439 
01440 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine MMDB_F_WRemark ( iUnit,Line,iRet )
01441 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer       iUnit,iRet
01442 //                        character*(*) Line
01443 
01444 //  Relation to the former WRemark FORTRAN subroutine:
01445 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
01446 //     subroutine  WRemark ( iUnit,Line )
01447 //
01448 //  ** the buffer for return code iRet has to be supplied
01449 
01450 FORTRAN_SUBR ( MMDB_F_WREMARK, mmdb_f_wremark,
01451                (    // lengths-at-end list
01452                 int     * iUnit, // unit number; *iUnit<=0 means
01453                                  // "the last mentioned unit"
01454                 mmdb::machine::fpstr     Line,  // line to be added
01455                 int     * iRet,  // return code:
01456                                  //   RWBERR_Ok  - success
01457                                  //   RWBERR_NoChannel     if unit
01458                                  //              iUnit was not
01459                                  //              initialized
01460                                  //   RWBERR_NoFile        if unit
01461                                  //              has been disposed
01462                                  // other return codea are those
01463                                  // returned by mmdb_f_open1_(..)
01464                 int    Line_len  // fortran-hidden length of Line
01465                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
01466                 int * iUnit,
01467                 mmdb::machine::fpstr Line, int * iRet
01468                ), ( // lengths-follow list
01469                 int * iUnit,
01470                 mmdb::machine::fpstr Line, int Line_len, int *iRet
01471                )
01472              );

01520 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
01521 
01522 //   rberrstop_(..) checks the return code got from one of the above
01523 // functions, and if it indicates an error, it issues the following
01524 // type of message (example)
01525 //
01526 //  *** RWBROOK error: point code unit    function
01527 //  ***                   12   -3    3    MMDB_F_Open
01528 //  *** file   : input.pdb
01529 //  *** reason : cannot open a file
01530 //  *** Execution stopped.
01531 //
01532 // if iStop is set to 0, and one of the following type
01533 //
01534 //  *** RWBROOK error: point code unit    function
01535 //  ***                   12   -3    3    MMDB_F_Open
01536 //  *** file   : input.pdb
01537 //  *** reason : cannot open a file
01538 //  *** continue running, may crash ...
01539 //
01540 // if iStop is not null.
01541 //
01542 //   iPlace (12 in the above samples) should be given a number which
01543 // is unique through an application; it serves to the identifying
01544 // the particular call which caused the problem. The return code
01545 // (-3 in the above samples) is that what is back in the iRet
01546 // parameter to the above functions. If iRet is set to RWBERR_Ok,
01547 // rberrstop_(..) makes no action. If rberrstop_(..) is called
01548 // immediately after a call to an RWBROOK function, e.g.
01549 //
01550 //    call MMDB_F_Open ( FName,RWStat,FType,iUnit,iRet )
01551 //    call RBErrStop   ( 12,iRet,iUnit,0 )
01552 //
01553 // then the name of the misfunctioned call (MMDB_F_Open in the above
01554 // samples) will be identified automatically and correctly.
01555 
01556 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine RBErrStop ( iPlace,iRet,
01557 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                          iUnit ,iStop )
01558 //                        integer  iUnit,iPlace,iRet,iStop
01559 
01560 FORTRAN_SUBR ( RBERRSTOP, rberrstop,
01561                (   //    lengths-at-end list
01562                 int * iPlace, // (unique) identificator inside an application
01563                 int * iRet,   // return code to check
01564                 int * iUnit,  // unit number
01565                 int * iStop   // if 0 then stop if error
01566                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
01567                 int * iPlace, int * iRet,
01568                 int * iUnit,  int * iStop
01569                ), ( // lengths-follow list
01570                 int * iPlace, int * iRet,
01571                 int * iUnit,  int * iStop
01572                ) );
01573 
01574 
01575 
01576 // ------------------------------------------------------------------
01577 
01578 //   rbcheckerr_(..) represents a simplified call to rberrstop_(..).
01579 // It will work properly only if rbcheckerr_(..) is called
01580 // immediately after an API function to be checked:
01581 //
01582 //    call MMDB_F_Open ( FName,RWStat,FType,iUnit,iRet )
01583 //    call RBCheckErr  ( 12,0 )
01584 //
01585 
01586 //  FORTRAN equivalent:   subroutine RBCheckErr ( iPlace,iStop )
01587 //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   integer  iPlace,iStop
01588 
01589 FORTRAN_SUBR ( RBCHECKERR, rbcheckerr,
01590                (   //    lengths-at-end list
01591                 int * iPlace, // (unique) identificator inside an application
01592                 int * iStop   // if 0 then stop if error
01593                ), ( // lengths-in-structure list
01594                 int * iPlace, int * iStop
01595                ), ( // lengths-follow list
01596                 int * iPlace, int * iStop
01597                ) );
